page.title: 02Life on a Farm ...
page.content: My name is Paul Povey and I live on a farm.We have one hundred and nineteen acres of land.We are a mixed farm.Due to the milk quota we only have twenty two milking cows(we used to have 30). We have four hundred and thirty sheep ,mainly Swale's, but we also have gritstone,mule and masham.We don't grow many cerials now because the reservoir took ten acres of good land and seventeen acres of grazing land. My mum rears calves and sells them but my dad gets the money.We have a few chickens so we don't have to buy eggs. The disadvantages of living on a farm are that you work seven days a week, long hours and it is very hard work. The advantages of living on a farm are that you are in the countryside and in the fresh air most of the time.You also mix with a lot of animals!
